source_sentence: 藥師如來念誦儀軌一卷
translation: Ritual Procedure for Recitation to the Master of Healing Tathāgata, One Volume

source_sentence: 大興善寺三藏沙門大廣智
translation: Great Extensive Wisdom of the Tripiṭaka Monks of Daxingshan Temple
Amoghasiddhi Translation of the imperial edict

source_sentence: 佛一時在維那離音樂樹下。
translation: One time, the Buddha was under the music tree at Vināli.
He was accompanied by 36,000 monks and nuns.
He was accompanied by 12 guardian kings.

source_sentence: 并諸眷屬天龍八部大神王。
translation: He was accompanied by his retinue, the great god kings of the gods and dragons and the eight groups of gods.
They were in this kind of large assembly.
After speaking this teaching, the large crowd heard it and rejoiced.
Everyone who heard it rejoiced.
This is called the wish-granting spell.
That's when the Bhagavān spoke the spell, saying.

source_sentence: 南謨薄伽筏帝鞞殺社寠嚕蔽瑠璃鉢唎婆喝囉闍耶怛他揭多怛姪他唵鞞殺逝鞞殺社三沒揭帝婆婆呵若有受持此真言。
translation: "Namo bhagavatn vaiśeṣa roruṣka lapis lazuli pārijāta otaninta ot vaiśeṣa jaya tathāgata tathāninta ot vaiśeṣa vaiśeṣa sambhogatti bhāvahā If anyone accepts and upholds this true saying, it will remove all the heavy sins of past birth-and-death in their bodies.

source_sentence: 能拔身中過去生死一切重罪。
translation: It'll remove all the heavy sins of past birth and death from your body.
They'll no longer experience the three destinies.
They'll be freed from the nine vexations and transcend all suffering.
This is the true mantra of the fundamental seal.

source_sentence: 以左右手頭指以下八指。
translation: Take the eight fingers of your left and right hands from the head finger down.
Put them back together in your palms with the fingers folded.
Using the two large fingers, he goes, "Om ḍākinī svāhā.
"Om ḍākinī svāhā.
"Second, he praises the virtues of the buddhas and the bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 薩縛勃馱曩薩縛爾曩(入)迦盧拏怛麼(二合平)迦訶羅(引)覩迷(存念於我)俱嚕吠女哩也(二合)入縛羅(引)怛他誐多麼訶捺耶(成就義)曩謨悉羯羅(歸命頂禮義)藥師如來念誦儀軌一卷
translation: Svabhadra Anāthapiṇḍada Anāthapiṇḍada (in the sense of accomplishment), Nāgârjuna Tamā (in the sense of flattening), Kahalā (in the sense of prostrating in homage), Kuru Vaiḍūrya (in the sense of entering into bondage), Tathāgata Godānāma (in the sense of accomplishment), and Nāgârjuna Sikhāra (in the sense of prostrating in homage), one scroll of the Ritual Procedure for Recitation to the Master of Healing Tathāgata.
